meanings.definition: To release an egg from the ovary.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the chicken ovulated an egg for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She ovulated an egg during her monthly cycle.
meanings.sent3: The hen ovulated an egg that was so big, it surprised the farmer.
meanings.sent4: The flower ovulated its seeds into the wind, spreading new life.
meanings.sent5: The ovulated egg was like a tiny treasure waiting to be found.

meanings.definition: Having released an egg from the ovary.
meanings.sent1: The ovulated egg was ready for fertilization.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved after the ovulated egg left her ovary.
meanings.sent3: The ovulated chicken strutted proudly around the coop.
meanings.sent4: The ovulated flower stood tall, proud of its seeds.
meanings.sent5: The ovulated egg was a sign of potential new life.
